application.name: table2cube
application.brief: Converts a table to a cube
application.description: This program converts a single field of a table into a cube. The table records will become lines in the output cube, and the table field data will become samples. So, a field with an array of size three and twenty records will produce a 3 sample by 20 line cube.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: Specify the input file containing table data.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: Specify the output file, which will be a cube populated with the data from the table.

parameter.name: TABLENAME
parameter.description: Specify the table name inside of the table input file (FROM).

parameter.name: FIELD
parameter.description: Specify the field name inside of the cube to gather the data from. The size of the array inside of this field will be the same as the number of samples in the output cube (unless otherwise specified).

parameter.name: STARTREC
parameter.description: Specify the starting record inside of the table. Use this if you want to skip initial data. One Based.

parameter.name: NUMREC
parameter.description: Specify the number of records to convert, this starts with the first record specified by STARTREC. One Based.

parameter.name: STARTELEM
parameter.description: Specify the starting element in the field. For example, if you have an array of size three but only want the last element this should be set to three. One Based.

parameter.name: NUMELEM
parameter.description: Specify the number of elements in the field to convert into the output cube, this starts with the first record specified by STARTELEM. One Based.
